messages.message:
Hi All, in order to cope with our tight SOC2 deadline, we are making some temporary changes on user permission to jenkins.instabase.com (http://jenkins.instabase.com), those changes will be reverted once we have our saas production jenkins instance up and running and migrate our release to that instance (ETA 1-1.5 months), starting from today:
1. all users except release team will no longer have jenkins admin permission 
2. logged in users will *still have permissions to* 
    a. read access job status/results/logs
    b. read access to job config
    c. start builds _*`except`*_ the following jobs
        i. certify-release (you can still run certify-all job)
        ii. deploy-dogfood
        iii. deploy-uat
3. among all the permissions we took away, specially, logged in user (except release team) `will no longer be able to`:
    a. update jenkins job configuration (note: you can still modify the groovy file in our code base)
    b. create new jenkins job
      if you need help with those, please make request in <#C035SLYCJ9X|> and tag the <!subteam^S038TM462UX> and we can set up job level permission for your use case.
